UX_Priority: Thumb zone bottom 1/3. Min touch target 44px. Single column layout only.
Guidelines: Test at 320px width. No horizontal scroll. Stack all content vertically.

UX_Priority: Primary test device. Thumb zone critical. Bottom nav preferred.
Guidelines: Design mobile-first at 390px. Safe area insets for notch. Bottom navigation pattern.

UX_Priority: Larger touch targets possible. Can fit 2-column grid for cards.
Guidelines: Test content density. Can show more data than standard mobile. Still single-hand use.

UX_Priority: Material Design guidelines. System back button. Different safe areas.
Guidelines: Account for Android navigation bar. Test with different font scales. Edge-to-edge design.

UX_Priority: Minimal device. Must work with reduced content.
Guidelines: Test with smallest viewport. Truncate text with ellipsis. Reduce image quality for performance.

UX_Priority: Split between mobile and tablet layout. Can show sidebar overlay.
Guidelines: Transition point for layout. Consider showing tablet layout with collapsible sidebar.

UX_Priority: Full tablet layout. Persistent sidebar viable. Multi-column content.
Guidelines: Two-column layout minimum. Persistent navigation sidebar. Larger touch targets OK.

UX_Priority: Near-desktop experience. Full multi-pane layouts possible.
Guidelines: Three-column layout viable. Split view support. Desktop-like density acceptable.

UX_Priority: Android tablet. Bottom navigation still common. Material guidelines.
Guidelines: Material Design 3 tablet patterns. Navigation rail preferred over bottom bar.

UX_Priority: Primary desktop target. Hover states required. Mouse-first interaction.
Guidelines: Full desktop layout. Sidebar + content. Dropdown menus. Hover tooltips enabled.

UX_Priority: Maximum content width ~1280px for readability. Center content.
Guidelines: max-width container. Generous whitespace. Multi-column dashboards. Data tables.

UX_Priority: Scale UI. Don't just stretch. Increase content density or zoom.
Guidelines: Use rem/em units. Test with browser zoom 150-200%. Don't hardcode pixel values.

UX_Priority: Glanceable information only. Single action per screen. Large text.
Guidelines: Max 3-4 items visible. Swipe navigation. No complex forms. Status-focused. Font 17pt minimum.

UX_Priority: Wear OS patterns. Tile-based layout. Quick actions only.
Guidelines: Circular layout consideration. Edge complications. Voice-first interaction support.

UX_Priority: Compact front screen. Quick tasks only. Notifications and status.
Guidelines: Cover screen UI. Simplified controls only. Large touch targets on narrow screen.

UX_Priority: Tablet-like when open. Adapt layout seamlessly on fold/unfold.
Guidelines: Flex mode support (half screen). Continuity from folded to unfolded state. Media queries for fold.

UX_Priority: D-pad navigation. Large text (min 24px). 10-foot viewing distance.
Guidelines: Focus-based navigation. No hover states. Card-based grid. High contrast for viewing distance.

UX_Priority: Leanback library patterns. D-pad focus management. Overscan margin.
Guidelines: 80px overscan margin. Focus ring on all items. Horizontal scrolling rows. No text input.

UX_Priority: Glanceable. Large buttons. Minimal text. Drive-safe design.
Guidelines: Maximum 6 items visible. 76px minimum touch target. No scrolling. Voice-first.

UX_Priority: Spatial UI patterns. Depth layers. Gaze-based interaction. Comfort zones.
Guidelines: Place UI at 1-2m distance. Avoid rapid movement. Use spatial audio cues. Curved panels.
